Nearly 3.3 million people are out of work. Hospitals are overflowing. And things will only get worse before they get better. 

Our job isn't over.

RT @cmclymer Happy Birthday to @SpeakerPelosi, who was an outspoken champion of LGBTQ rights decades before the movement gained mainstream acceptance. We live in a terribly complex and uncertain moment, and I'm grateful she's at the helm.

I’m speaking with reporters live at the U.S. Capitol.

Couldn't let the day pass by without wishing a happy birthday to my fellow Californian and our fearless leader, @SpeakerPelosi. Thank you for holding this administration accountable at every turn and tirelessly working for the people. I’m glad to be by your side in this fight.

The CARES Act was designed to provide real help to people who are hurting. It will:
💵Send checks to individuals/families ($1,200 per adult & $500 per child)
💵Provide $377B in emergency relief for small biz, which will help keep employees on the payroll
http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1243066175103393792/pu/img/RZ3O8xYWEB5ILfVb.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1243066175103393792/pu/vid/480x270/j1mq3MGRSmrLaynX.mp4?tag=10

The coronavirus is spreading quickly, and the reality is that CVS workers are among some of those at the highest risk and are less likely to have paid sick leave.

Add your name to this petition to demand CVS provide a safe workplace for workers: https://www.coworker.org/petitions/join-other-retailers-and-do-more-for-your-employees-and-more-for-social-distancing?source=tw200326

Medicare for All means never losing your health insurance if you lose your job. That is what we must guarantee to the American people.

The next steps as we put #FamiliesFirst?

-Expanding who qualifies for paid family & medical leave

-Stronger OSHA protections for workers

-Action to protect pensions

-Increase SNAP funding

-More funding for state & local governments

-Ensuring free coronavirus treatment

RT @TheRightScoop WATCH: Ted Cruz reacts to the $2 trillion stimulus plan that passed the Senate last night https://wp.me/pqwpd-1jNO http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUCjEHOXYAEcz_L.jpg

The Senate's #COVID19 relief package provides support for hardworking Americans, families, and businesses. A summary of the CARES Act, as well as coronavirus resources and guidance for Utahns, can be found on my website: https://www.romney.senate.gov/coronavirus
It's clear that more work will need to be done in the weeks ahead to save lives and rescue our economy. But this relief package is a good start and will provide immediate help to many who need it.

RT @CAPAC #ICYMI: Earlier today, #CAPAC First Vice Chair @RepGraceMeng introduced a congressional resolution to denounce anti-Asian sentiment related to COVID-19. Read our full statement👇

https://capac-chu.house.gov/press-release/capac-applauds-introduction-resolution-denounce-anti-asian-sentiment-caused-covid-19 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUAedxVWoAU6yOt.jpg

People are scared. 

We've got a global pandemic. 

And in addition to a health crisis, we are in an economic disaster where millions of people are losing their jobs. 

In response to that devastation, everyone feels an urgency to provide relief: http://verdictpodcast.com/ #Verdict

Unacceptable that these companies aren't providing adequate paid leave for all their workers right now. I've sent a letter calling on them to do so immediately:

McDonald’s, Walmart, Kroger, Subway, Burger King, Pizza Hut, Target, Marriott, Wendy’s, Taco Bell, Dollar General—

Until we substantially increase our medical capacities, we cannot send people back to work, and our economy will continue to suffer. Exposing more people to the virus, and causing them to be hospitalized or die from COVID-19, is both a moral & economic failure.

Late last night, the Senate rose above partisan politics and policy differences and unanimously passed legislation that will provide everyone who is hurting right now with real and meaningful relief. Together we will get through this and together we will #CombatCovid19.
🎥:@wusa9 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1243181082838786049/pu/img/-xEVa07DB8EPTIvT.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1243181082838786049/pu/vid/320x568/X6DlapwLpKrXUDgr.mp4?tag=10

Congress should require @HHSgov to report demographic info for people tested to make sure tests are being distributed equally. And manufacturers should have to report their test capacity & resources daily so our federal response is accurate & communities aren’t being left behind.

What Trump + Senate GOP have done is hold hospitals, working people, and the vulnerable hostage so they could get in $500 billion (that will be leveraged into $4T) in corporate welfare.

Without the Wall St giveaway, GOP refuses to fund hospitals & unemployment. It’s inhumane.

It is well with my soul. Beautiful. #AmericaTogether http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1243265267658100737/img/4bapqCJRWS0mJghN.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1243265267658100737/vid/480x270/fYMKs_g_YCVxc1WZ.mp4?tag=13

The $2 trillion relief package will go a long way to help families and small businesses, but make no mistake we have so much more to do to protect Americans and our most vulnerable. This crisis is far from over—but we will get through it together. https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/25/whats-in-stimulus-package-coronavirus-149282

Yesterday's passed bill is a critical first step for those who need our help:
—Cash payments up to $1,200 for many Americans & $500 for children
—Expanded unemployment insurance
—$150B for states, tribes & localities
—$377B for small business relief
—Over $100B for our hospitals

The Trump administration mishandled its coronavirus response, but our problems aren’t insurmountable. We need diagnostics. We need information. We need personnel. And we need Congress to step up and help provide them – right now.

Small business program will only work if we have heavy participation from banks & other lenders. 

Many branches closed due to #COVIDー19 restrictions. 

But we are working with lenders & they are now increasing their existing online capacity to process the small business grants.

RT @wendyrsherman Happy Birthday @SpeakerPelosi !! Your leadership and you are a national treasure. As a fellow Baltimore gal, just wish we were celebrating in Little Italy! But time to be safe and be well. Thank you for being you fighting for everyone everyday.

There’s a crisis devastating our country. Millions are struggling.

Make no mistake: we will continue taking action to put #FamiliesFirst. https://twitter.com/dustingardiner/status/1243253731040387073 QT @dustingardiner NEW: Here’s what Nancy Pelosi wants in Congress’ next big coronavirus bill (House hasn't even voted on $2 trillion yet): https://www.sfchronicle.com/politics/article/Here-s-what-Nancy-Pelosi-wants-in-Congress-15159466.php

#CoronavirusPandemic #COVIDー19 #stimulus #economy @sfchronicle @SpeakerPelosi

This is not the time for Congress to go on recess. Our work isn't done. We need to force Trump to use the Defense Production Act to ramp up the development of tests and necessary equipment for health care professionals. And we need to do more to help struggling families.

The Trump administration was given a step-by-step guide of what to do during a pandemic—they ignored it. Coronavirus has killed more than 1,000 Americans already.  
https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/25/trump-coronavirus-national-security-council-149285

Items that *are* in the bill:
- $200b for hospitals
- $150b for state + local govs
- 4 mos expanded unemployment insurance, incl gig workers & others
- $377b for small biz loans w/ forgiveness eligibility
- $30b in emergency education funding

The CARES Act includes priorities I’ve urged the Admin and Congress to address:
✔️Delivers support for first responders working to #CombatCovid19
✔️Ensures hospitals have critical supplies & equipment
✔️Speeds up the approval process for treatments
✔️Expands the use of HSAs

Applebees, Dunkin’ Donuts, Sonic, Publix, Chick-fil-A, Holiday Inn, Dominos, Walgreens, Cracker Barrel, CVS, KFC, JC Penny, IHOP, Panera, Meijer, Dollar Tree, Lowe’s, Wegmans, Jimmy Johns, Old Navy, Kmart, UPS, Gap, Sam’s Club, and the Cheesecake Factory.
